fixes.name: Loss Flag
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF([Profit]<0,1,0) to DAX IF for a row-level calculated column with table-qualified column reference.

fixes.name: Discount Tier
fixes.dax_expression: IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health] > 0.25, "High Discount", IF('Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health] > 0.10, "Medium Discount", "Low Discont"))
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau nested IF/ELSEIF to nested DAX IF statements for a row-level calculated column, using the 'Discount Health' calculated column and table-qualified references.

fixes.name: Failure Risk
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Loss Flag] = 1 &&
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Tier] = "High Discount ",
    "High Risk",
    "Low Risk"
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF with logical AND to DAX IF using &&, comparing the row-level calculated columns 'Loss Flag' and 'Discount Tier' with table-qualified references. This is a row-level classification so implemented as a calculated column.
